poem:
Title: Hope in Bethnal Green

In silent Bethnal, where actors convene, 
Seated before electric mouths, 
Dream-spinners weave tangible scenes.
In the margins hold sway, directors unseen, 
Breathing life into the frail Arctic snow, 
Stationed in green, pledging hope yet sown.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘We want the audience to feel there is hope’: how to write a play about the climate crisis, by the team behind The Jungle and Little Amal The rehearsal room in London’s Bethnal Green has a concentrated, businesslike and anticipatory atmosphere. It is filled with people sitting at tables with microphones in front of them, as though a conference were about to begin, which, in a sense, it is. On the stage’s periphery are directors". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
